instructions.inst: Season chicken with salt and pepper.
Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside.
In a large pan or skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic to the pan and sauté until fragrant, about 1 minute.
Add the seasoned chicken to the pan and cook until browned on all sides, about 5-7 minutes.
Reduce the heat to medium and pour in the heavy cream, stirring to combine with the chicken and garlic.
Let the sauce simmer for 3-5 minutes, or until it begins to thicken slightly.
Add grated parmesan cheese to the pan and stir until it is fully melted and incorporated into the sauce.
Toss the cooked pasta with the sauce until it is evenly coated.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley or additional parmesan cheese if desired.
In a pan, heat olive oil and sauté onions and garlic.
Add ground beef and cook until browned.
Add tomatoes and red wine.
Let it simmer for 30 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over pasta.
Cut vegetables into bite-sized pieces.
In a large pan or wok, heat oil over high heat.
Add minced garlic and onions to the pan and stir fry until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the prepared vegetables to the pan and stir fry for 5-7 minutes, or until they are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, cornstarch, and water until smooth.
Pour the sauce over the vegetables in the pan and mix well to coat.
Let the vegetables simmer in the sauce for 2-3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens and the vegetables are fully coated.
Serve hot over rice, garnished with sliced green onions or sesame seeds if desired.
Season shrimp with salt and pepper, set aside.
Cook pasta according to package instructions, drain and set aside.
In a large pan, heat butter and olive oil over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic to the pan and sauté until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes.
Add the seasoned shrimp to the pan and cook until they turn pink, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Pour in lemon juice and let it simmer for a minute or two to let the flavors meld.
Add the cooked pasta to the pan with the shrimp and sauce.
Toss the pasta until it is evenly coated with the sauce.
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired.
Slice beef into thin strips and set aside.
In a large pan, melt butter over medium-high heat and sauté onions until softened and lightly browned.
Add the beef strips to the pan and cook until browned on all sides, stirring occasionally.
Add sliced mushrooms to the pan and cook until they release their moisture and become tender.
Sprinkle flour over the mixture and stir until the flour is fully absorbed.
Slowly pour in beef broth while stirring constantly to avoid lumps.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for a few minutes, until the sauce thickens.
Stir in sour cream until fully combined.
Season the beef stroganoff with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.
In a pot, melt butter over medium heat and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant and softened.
Add canned tomatoes and vegetable broth to the pot.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for 30 minutes.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until it is smooth and creamy.
Pour the blended soup back into the pot.
Add heavy cream to the pot and stir until fully combined.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with croutons on top.
Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente.
In a blender or food processor, combine fresh basil leaves, minced garlic, grated parmesan cheese, pine nuts, salt, and pepper.
With the blender running, slowly pour in olive oil until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
Toss the cooked pasta with the pesto sauce until fully coated.
Serve hot with extra parmesan cheese on top.
In a pot, heat olive oil over medium heat and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant and softened.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook until tender and lightly browned.
Stir in arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes, until the grains are coated with the oil.
Pour in white wine and cook, stirring constantly, until the liquid has been absorbed.
Gradually add chicken broth, one cup at a time, stirring occasionally and allowing each cup to be absorbed before adding the next.
Continue cooking the risotto until the rice is tender and creamy, about 20-25 minutes in total.
Stir in butter and grated parmesan cheese until fully melted and combined.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.
Thinly slice the beef into strips.
Cut the broccoli into small florets.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, cornstarch, and water.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat, and add minced garlic. Cook until fragrant.
Add the sliced beef to the pan and cook until browned.
Add the broccoli florets to the pan and stir-fry for 3-5 minutes, until tender but still slightly crisp.
Pour the sauce mixture over the beef and broccoli.
Let the mixture simmer for 2-3 minutes, until the sauce thickens and coats the beef and broccoli.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with rice.
Melt butter in a pot and sauté onions and garlic until tender.
Add canned tomatoes and chicken broth.
Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes.
Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes.
Using an immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth.
Stir in heavy cream and basil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot and enjoy!
Preheat oven to 375°F.
Toss carrots and beets with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Spread in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until tender and lightly browned.
In a small bowl, whisk together honey and lemon juice to make the dressing.
Arrange arugula leaves on a serving plate.
Top with roasted carrots and beets.
Sprinkle goat cheese and walnuts on top.
Drizzle with the honey and lemon dressing
Preheat oven to 400°F.
Mix panko breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in a shallow dish.
Beat the egg in a separate shallow dish.
Dip chicken tenderloins in the egg, then coat in the breadcrumb mixture.
Arrange on a baking sheet and drizzle with olive oil.
Bake in the oven for 15-20 minutes, or until crispy and golden brown.
Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce and enjoy!
Preheat oven to 375°F.
In a skillet, cook ground beef until browned.
Add onion and garlic and sauté for 5 minutes.
Stir in canned diced tomatoes and cooked rice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Fill each halved bell pepper with the beef and rice mixture.
Top with shredded cheddar cheese.
Bake in the oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Serve hot and enjoy!
